alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 26 at 12:15PM AKST until January 28 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions with reduced visibility to a half mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches, with localized amounts up to 8 inches, are expected. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range including Isabel Pass and Mentasta Pass. * WHEN...Midnight to 6 AM Friday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Look for reduced visibilities at times. North winds gusting to 35 mph from Trims Camp south will result in significant blowing and drifting at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
